attributes.action: do all he can to support the nomination of  Caroline McElhill for a posthumous award in recognition of her courage.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Caroline McElhill was one of the victims of the fire tradegy in Omagh, County Tyrone, on 13 November 2007.

The Police Service of Northern Ireland have stated that "at 4.54am on November 13, a 999 call was made to the Fire and Rescue Service from within 4 Lammy Crescent. The investigation team have established that Caroline, at 13 years of age, had the presence of mind and bravery to seek help from the emergency services to save her family."

“Caroline was recovered with her telephone in one hand and her rosary beads in her other hand. This was a young girl, an emblem of innocence, with the courage to seek help and turning to her faith in the midst of fear and danger."

Detective Chief Superintendent Norman Baxter, of the PSNI added: "It is my intention at the appropriate time to acknowledge Caroline's actions in seeking help for her family by nominating her for a posthumous award in recognition of her courage."
